channel.title: Welcome To Mars
channel.description: This is an archive of the Welcome to Mars 12-part series. It is an audio discussion of the facts and fiction of American science in the middle of the 20th century.

item.title: Programme 1: 1947: Rebuilding Lemuria
item.description: "The first Levittown is opened to the American public. Suburbia had begun to expand its grand conformity into space..."

item.title: Programme 2: 1948-1949: Flying Saucers Over America
item.description: "On January the 7th, 1948 Captain Thomas Mantell plummets to his death while pursuing what he reports as a flying saucer over Fort Knox, Kentuky."

item.title: Programme 3: 1950: Cheapness and Splendour
item.description: "...unhappy the child whose parent gives their tacit agreement to their participation in the science club project because what's not made clear...is that the extra calcium that's been added to the little one's oatmeal is radioactive."

item.title: Programme 4: 1951: Absolute Elsewhere
item.description: "Nothing from this point forward is likely to be as it seems."

item.title: Programme 5: 1952: Red Planet
item.description: "1952 was filled with signs and portents indicating strange beginnings and violent ends."

item.title: Programme 6: 1953: Other Tongues, Other Flesh
item.description: "War of the Worlds is very much a film about hardware, not fantasy..."

item.title: Programme 7: 1954: Meet the Monsters
item.description: "The word "never" cancels out events for all eternity; consigns them to non-being."

item.title: Programme 8: 1955: Popular Mechanics
item.description: "There's talk of a new family of nuclear weapons and newborn baby called hope, but it soon becomes clear that bombing strategies can have a strange effect on the average person's home life."

item.title: Programme 9: 1956: Greetings, My Friends!
item.description: "The lights go up inside the darkened shell of Quality Studios and the Amazing Criswell stares confidently into the lens of a whirring movie camera..."

item.title: Programme 10: 1957: Contact With Space
item.description: "The American people were suddenly alerted to a new sound sweeping the planet..."

item.title: Programme 11: 1958: Battle for the Mind
item.description: "What do we know now that we didn't before?"

item.title: Programme 12: 1959: Teenagers from Outer Space
item.description: "While Ed Wood was busy getting Plan 9 From Outer Space ready for its final release, astronomer and UFO researcher Morris K. Jessup was preparing to take his own life..."
